hints.content: As an embryo develops, it takes on more of the specialized features of its species.
So, the embryo in the latest stage of development will have the *most* features in common with an adult mouse.

Of the three embryos shown, the one with the most features in common with an adult mouse is:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A mouse embryo with an embryonic spinal cord, a head, eyes, a tail, limbs, fingers, toes, ears, and a snout.

question.content:
Mice develop as embryos inside their mother and undergo live birth. The following illustration shows an adult mouse.

[[☃ image 1]]

The next three illustrations show mouse embryos. Each one is in a different stage of development. The illustrations are not drawn to scale.

**Of the three embryos, which one is in the LATEST stage of development?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.alt: A mouse with white fur. The mouse has a head, eyes, a tail, four limbs, fingers, toes, ears, a snout, and whiskers.

![A mouse embryo with an embryonic spinal cord, a head, eyes, a tail, and limbs.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/26b5523bf2fada32c935b3781eaa5703ebc85524.png)
